TotalEnergies accused of 'complicity in war crimes' in Mozambique
subhead: In the summer of 2021, Mozambican civilians were detained and tortured by soldiers guarding TotalEnergies's gas site. A non-governmental organization is challenging the responsibility of the French multinational company.

Senegal's ruling duo splinters
subhead: President Bassirou Diomaye Faye and his prime minister, Ousmane Sonko, who came to power on promises of a political break, are now increasingly airing their differences in public.

title: Macron to visit Marseille in December after dramatic drug-related killing
subhead: On Thursday, November 13, the brother of environmental activist Amine Kessaci, who was committed to fighting drug-related crime, was shot dead in Marseille. Government officials described the incident as a 'tipping point.'

title: Captain Alfred Dreyfus receives posthumous promotion 130 years after scandal
subhead: The former Jewish French army officer who was wrongfully convicted of espionage amid widespread antisemitism in the early 20th century was promoted to brigadier general as an act of reparation.

title: 'No one ever called us': Retired French police officer stunned to learn of daughter's death online, three months after burial
subhead: Jean Forest discovered this summer that his daughter Marjolaine, a university scholar, had been buried in the spring. He investigated why his family was not informed and denounces the administrative and social indifference he encountered.

subhead: A false rumor that acts of torture were committed during the attack on the Bataclan hall venue was revived by the French far right and confirmed by Grok, which invented victim testimonies.

title: What is Europe's 'fair share' of climate action compared to other countries?
subhead: Europe produces only 6% of today's global greenhouse gas emissions, a point some politicians use to play down the continent's responsibility. Scientists counter that, looking at historical emissions, Europe still has far to go to meet the Paris Agreement.

title: Cryptocurrencies, a fast lane for money laundering
subhead: An international journalistic investigation of which Le Monde is a partner highlights the glaring weaknesses in cryptocurrency exchange platforms, used by criminals to launder money.
